alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 22 at 8:50PM PST until January 24 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...A New Long Period Swell Builds in Monday Afternoon... Forerunners of this long period westerly swell will arrive Monday afternoon when the risk for sneaker waves begins. Large sets of waves will sweep in after long lulls in wave activity. The swell will build up to 12 feet at 18 seconds by Tuesday morning. Steep beaches will have a higher risk of sneaker wave activity with greater wave run- up onto beaches. Large waves will also wash over jetties and rock outcroppings that may normally stay dry. In addition to the waves...high tides and large tidal swings are expected during the late morning hours each day through Tuesday and may cause localized coastal flooding around Humboldt Bay. ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Periods of unexpected larger waves along the coast. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Northern Humboldt Coast, Southwestern Humboldt and Mendocino Coast Counties. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Tuesday afternoon.. . * IMPACTS...Large, unexpected waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath.
info.instruction: Don`t be fooled by an ocean that looks calm. There can be 30 minutes of small waves before a sneaker wave strikes. Avoid rocks and jetties. Avoid steep beaches. Stay much farther back from the water and never turn your back on the ocean.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt
